title: How to Draw a Brick Wall

steps.title: Draw a 6 inch (15.2 cm) by 6 inch (15.2 cm) square.
steps.content: Draw a 6 inch (15.2 cm) by 6 inch (15.2 cm) square.

steps.title: Draw a 12x12 grid (consisting of half an inch per block) inside the square.
steps.content: Draw a 12x12 grid (consisting of half an inch per block) inside the square.

steps.title: Use a darker pencil to trace all of the horizontal lines.
steps.content: Use a darker pencil to trace all of the horizontal lines.

steps.title: At the first horizontal row that you created, draw a vertical line every 1 inch (2.5 cm) or 2 blocks of the grid.
steps.content: At the first horizontal row that you created, draw a vertical line every 1 inch (2.5 cm) or 2 blocks of the grid. Do this every other row (1st, 3rd, 5th, etc). At the second horizontal row, draw a vertical line at half an inch or the first block of the grid then measure 1 inch (2.5 cm) interval or 2 blocks of the grid then add another vertical line/s until you reach the end. Do this at every other row (2nd, 4th, 6th etc..)

steps.title: Ink the drawing.
steps.content: Ink the drawing. Don't forget to use your ruler and erase the sketch lines.

steps.title: Color your drawing and your brick wall is done.
steps.content: Color your drawing and your brick wall is done.
